report_title: Bed & Breakfast & Hostel Accommodations in the US
executive_summary: The bed & breakfast and hostel industry has evolved over the past several years, steadily expanding from budget-focused accommodations to form a vibrant cohort within the broader lodging sector. These establishments offer a one-of-a-kind, intimate hospitality experience, setting them apart from the uniformity and impersonality of larger hotels.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Restrictions Adversely Reduced Travel Activities
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Spending on recreational activities moves closely with per capita disposable income and leisure time. Therefore, before COVID-19, the industry benefited from a surge of retiring baby boomers who typically have ample leisure time and retirement income to travel. Both international and domestic travel rates slumped drastically after the coronavirus hit, deteriorating demand for accommodations in general. Also, many bed & breakfast and hostel operators were forced to temporarily shutter operations due to local restrictions and health concerns. As a result, industry revenue is estimated to have plunged 27.8% in 2020 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry has been Impacted by Airbnb-Style Short-Term Sublease Services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry has been particularly ravaged by Airbnb-style short-term sublease services. These platforms encapsulated a sizable share of budget accommodation clientele, principally targeting consumers aspiring for a more localized travel experience, which once housed this industry's unique selling proposition. However, optimism crackled for these small stalwarts arising from recent crackdowns on house-sharing services in major metropolitan areas. This unexpected regulatory shift has potentially swung open doors for bed & breakfasts and hostels, redirecting consumers back into their landscape.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry will Focus on Catering to a Niche Market
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Accommodations that find a niche, like establishments on farms or near tourist attractions, will fare better than others. To maintain their market share, hostels will offer significant competitive advantages like sightseeing and cultural tours, day excursions, bar crawls and other value-added services. Likewise, B&Bs will also focus on wellness like outdoor exercise classes and spa services. Many B&Bs have partnered with yoga and meditation centers to provide on-site sessions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry will Benefit from Stricter Short-Term Rental Regulations
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will continue to remain primarily small-business-focused despite increasing pressure for these lodgings to combine forces to ward off competition from hotels and providers of informal accommodation. In response to growing interest, many major hotel chains have begun to explore the prospect of increasing competition for the industry, particularly within urban areas.

industry_definition: The Bed and Breakfast and Hostel Accommodations industry comprises businesses that are primarily engaged in providing short-term lodging. Hotels, motels and casino hotels are excluded from this industry.

key_trends: In the accommodation industry, price wars are common due to similar services. Consequently, hostels and B&Bs enhance amenities and add extras to stand out.

market_segmentation.segment_description: In a study by travel research company Phocuswright, bed and breakfast (B&B) received the most bookings on their own property's website.
Popular among younger travelers, online travel agencies, including Airbnb Inc., TripAdvisor Inc. and BedandBreakfast.com, provided the second-greatest source of bookings at B&Bs.
Thanks to their popularity among older travelers, bed and breakfasts still generate a significant portion of their bookings from offline channels.
As online travel agencies become more user-friendly, travelers will rely less on travel agents to make travel arrangements.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Higher consumer spending represents an opportunity for the industry because visits to bed and breakfasts and hostels will potentially rise.

business_locations.location_description: B&B and hostel businesses are heavily concentrated in the Southeast, West, New England, and Mid-Atlantic regions. This geographic preference is mainly due to the concentration of tourist attractions, making these areas hotspots for both domestic and international visitors.

The Southeast and West regions are known for their plethora of locations and tourist spots. These regions witness a significant proportion of discretionary travelers, creating a heavy demand for accommodation businesses. This makes them prime locations for the industry.

Bed and breakfast have a significant presence within a two-hour drive from major urban areas such as California, New York, Minnesota, Maine, and Florida. This is a deliberate strategy to appeal to high-income professionals seeking quick getaways, making these establishments popular choices for short-break markets.

Numerous bed and breakfast and hostel businesses have strategically centralized their locations in popular tourist and business hubs, such as Phoenix, AZ; El Paso, TX; and Las Vegas, NV. The high influx of visitors for both leisure and professional engagement offers a continuous demand for their services.

In California, cities like Los Angeles, San Francisco, and San Diego accommodate such businesses due to their diverse attractions like beaches, amusement parks, and film studios and their corporate allure.
Miami, with its appealing beaches and weather, is a year-round tourist hotspot, significantly boosting vacancies at hostels and B&Bs.

regulations_points.regulation_title: REGULATORY CONFORMANCE IN THE HOSTEL INDUSTRY
regulations_points.regulation_description: While regulation in the hostel industry is not as stringent as in other sectors, significant rules still exist. The industry must adhere to local and state planning laws, including fire safety regulations.

Given that hostels collect and store guest data, they must comply with data protection regulations such as GDPR. These laws cover how personal information is held and used while protecting guest privacy.

basis_points.basis_description: In the accommodation industry, price wars are common due to similar services.
Consequently, hostels and B&Bs enhance amenities and add extras to stand out.
This industry's fragmentation is fueled by low initial costs.
By investing in new technologies, a slew of B&Bs and hostels are aiming to simplify their operations and cut labor dependence.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The number of hostels in the United States has traditionally been low.
Most bed and breakfast (B&B) establishments are owner-occupied and have an average of six rooms.
Hostels can vary from 25 beds in rural areas to up to 500 beds in central city locations.
Due to the owner-occupied nature of B&Bs, the number of these lodgings is generally low, resulting in low industry concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Primarily Include Guest Supplies and Cleaning Materials
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Guest supplies can include replaceable bedding products like sheets, blankets, towels and pillows. Other supplies can include food and beverages for meals, vending machines and replaceable cleaning products to ensure rooms are fit for use after a customer has departed.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor Input is High in the Industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labor is required for customer service, cleaning, room maintenance, marketing the property and preparing breakfast. As owner-operators often perform the majority of these tasks, wages are understated.

volatility_points.volatility_title: REVENUE VOLATILITY IN THE BED AND BREAKFAST AND HOSTEL ACCOMMODATIONS INDUSTRY IS HIGH
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry revenue grew despite shaky consumer confidence and external competition during most of the current period.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Hostels and bed-and-breakfast will continue to offer significant competitive advantages like sightseeing and cultural tours, day excursions, bar crawls and food options using local produce with local wines.
